description.narrative: 6300 people affected by food insecurity caused by the Syrian crisis

Syria is entering its fifth year of conflict in 2015. Humanitarian needs have increased twelve fold since the beginning of the crisis, with 12.2 million in need of humanitarian assistance, including 7.6 million internally displaced persons and more than 5.6 million children in need of assistance. An estimated 4.5 million people are in need of humanitarian assistance in hard to reach areas and locations. Food security remains of the primary humanitarian needs among IDPs. The main constraints affecting food security in Syria, are both on the demand-side and supply-side. The primary constraint in accessing food across Syria is economic. With decreased income-generating opportunities and increasing prices, households are experiencing increasing difficulties in meeting basic food requirements. On the supply-side, inadequate levels of local food production are reported as one of the main issues affecting food availability. Lack of inputs, reduced availability of products on the market, and reduction in cross-border access all severely affect the supply-chain

The overall objective of the project is that Lives of people affected by food insecurity caused by the Syrian crisis are saved, suffering alleviated and human dignity maintained. The specific objective it to save the lives of people affected by food insecurity in Aleppo by providing daily hot meals.
